data: Laser-cooled Cs frequency standard and a measurement of the frequency shift due to ultracold collisions

We demonstate a laser-cooled Cs fountain which can be used as a frequency standard. The fountain has been used to measure the frequency shift due to ultracold Cs-Cs collisions at temperatures below 2.8 μK. The measured shift is-12.9±0.7 mHz for a density of (2.7±1.5)× 10 9 cm− 3 beginning with an even distribution (±10%) among the F= 3, m F states. For a fountain with 95% of the atoms in the m F= 0 states, we measure a frequency shift of-5.5±0.5 mHz at a density of (3.5±2.0)× 10 8 cm− 3.
